definition: abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]

sentences.english: Gangs are buying assault weapons on the black market.
sentences.chinese: 黑帮总在黑市购置攻击性兵器。

sentences.english: A thriving black market helps fuel the Apple mania.
sentences.chinese: 繁荣的黑市帮助点燃了对苹果产品的狂热。

sentences.english: Black market is illegal trade in goods or money.
sentences.chinese: 黑市指的是商品或货币的非法贸易。

sentences.english: The restrictions also led many into black-market deals.
sentences.chinese: 这些限制还导致黑市交易。

sentences.english: Computers have been sold on Cuba's black market for years -- at prices comparable to the US$780 (euro505) now seen in the store.
sentences.chinese: 多年之前，电脑就已经在黑市上销售。

sentences.english: There is still a meat trade of wildlife in the black market. Have you ever had any venison?
sentences.chinese: 黑市仍然有野味交易，你有品尝野味的经历吗？

sentences.english: Around Beijing's small alleyways , an underground economy caters to construction workers.
sentences.chinese: 在北京的小胡同中，黑市迎合了建筑工人的需求。

sentences.english: Black-marketing and overcharging grew to proportions far beyond OPA policing capacity.
sentences.chinese: 黑市交易与高价销售盛行，物价管理局难以控制。

sentences.english: Cybercriminals rent out use of their botnets on the black market.
sentences.chinese: 网络罪犯们在黑市上出租他们的僵尸网络的使用权。

sentences.english: Poachers have been netting salmon to supply the black market .
sentences.chinese: 盗猎者一直在捕捞大麻哈鱼到黑市上去卖。

sentences.english: So far, no one appears to be panic buying black-market movies.
sentences.chinese: 目前好像还没有人抢购黑市的影片。

sentences.english: A black market has sprung up in fraudulent letters of completion.
sentences.chinese: 而一个伪造证件的黑市也应运而生。

sentences.english: Black markets, Schlosser writes, 'will always be with us.
sentences.chinese: 施洛瑟写道，黑市“总是会存在的。

sentences.english: Adding in black-market lending and the increasing use of IOUs to settle payments takes the total even higher.
sentences.chinese: 加上黑市贷款和越来越多地使用欠条，总数会更高。

sentences.english: The corruption is not limited to selling subsidized wheat flour on the black market.
sentences.chinese: 腐败现象不止是有人把平价面包拿到黑市上高价出售。

sentences.english: Counterfeit marriage licenses and birth certificates began appearing on the black market.
sentences.chinese: 黑市开始出现仿造的结婚证和出生证。

definition: to smuggle/to have an illicit affair
to resell at a profit/to speculate
to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle
to buy and sell at a profit/to speculate
(of a villain) to do the dirty on another villain
to auction/auction sale/to sell at a reduced price
